00:03:14:050000.Scene: The apartment living room. There is a knock on the door.
00:03:14:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:14:050000.Dialogue: We all have other costumes: We can change.

00:03:17:050000.Scene: The apartment living room. There is a knock on the door.
00:03:17:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:17:050000.Dialogue: Or we could walk right behind each other all night and look like one person going really fast.

00:03:29:190000.Scene: The apartment living room. There is a knock on the door.
00:03:29:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:29:190000.Dialogue: No, no, no. It's a boy-girl party, this flash runs solo.

00:03:36:000000.Scene: The apartment living room. There is a knock on the door.
00:03:36:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:36:000000.Dialogue: Okay, how about this? Nobody gets to be The Flash. We all change. Agreed?

00:03:41:020000.Speaker: All

00:03:57:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:57:100000.Dialogue: Sorry I'm late, but my hammer got stuck in the door on the bus.

00:04:02:000000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:02:000000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:03:000000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:03:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:03:000000.Dialogue: What, just because I'm Indian I can't be a Norse god?

00:04:06:190000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:06:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:06:190000.Dialogue: No, no, Raj has to be an Indian god.

00:04:10:000000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:10:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:10:000000.Dialogue: That's racism. I mean look at Wolowitz.He's not English, but he's dressed like Peter Pan. Sheldon is neither sound nor light, but he's obviously the Doppler effect.

00:04:25:020000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:25:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:25:020000.Dialogue: I'm not Peter Pan. I'm Robin Hood.

00:04:28:020000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:28:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:28:020000.Dialogue: Really? Because I sawPeter Pan, and you're dressed exactly like Cathy Rigby.

00:04:33:190000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:33:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:33:190000.Dialogue: She was a little bigger than you, but it's basically the same look, man.

00:04:38:140000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:38:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:38:140000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon, there's something I want to talk to you about before we go to the party.

00:04:41:120000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:41:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:41:120000.Dialogue: I don't care if anybody gets it. I'm going as the Doppler effect.

00:04:46:100000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:46:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:53:170000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:53:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:04:56:170000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:04:56:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:56:170000.Dialogue: this party is my first chance for Penny to see me in the context of her social group, and I need you not to embarrass me tonight.

00:05:06:100000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:06:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:06:100000.Dialogue: Well, what exactly do you mean by embarrass you?

00:05:09:070000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:09:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:09:070000.Dialogue: Well, for example, tonight, no one needs to know that my middle name is Leakey.

00:05:14:170000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:14:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:14:170000.Dialogue: But there's nothing embarrassing about that. Your father worked with Louis Leakey, a great anthropologist. It had nothing to do with your bed-wetting.

00:05:24:070000.Scene: The same, later. Leonard is dressed as Frodo. Howard appears to be Peter Pan. There is a knock on the door.
00:05:24:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:24:070000.Dialogue: All m saying is that this party is the perfect opportunity for Penny to see me as a member of her peer group, a potential close friend, and perhaps more, and I don't want to look like a dork.

00:05:48:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:05:48:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:48:020000.Dialogue: Just a heads up, fellas. If anyone gets lucky, I've got a dozen condoms in my quiver.

00:05:54:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:05:54:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:05:56:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:05:56:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:58:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:05:58:000000.Speaker: Penny

00:06:00:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:00:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:00:020000.Dialogue: And you said the party starts at 7:00.

00:06:02:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:02:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:02:070000.Dialogue: Well, yeah, I mean, when you start a party at 7:00, no one shows up at, you know, 7:00.

00:06:08:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:08:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:11:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:11:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:11:050000.Dialogue: Yes. Yes, it is. Okay. Well, um, come on in.

00:06:23:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:23:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:23:070000.Dialogue: So, what, are all the girls in the bathroom?

00:06:26:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:26:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:26:050000.Dialogue: Probably, but in their own homes.

00:06:30:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:30:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:30:000000.Dialogue: So, what time does the costume parade start?

00:06:33:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:33:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:06:34:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:34:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:34:220000.Dialogue: Yeah, so the judges can give out the prizes for best costume. You know, most frightening, most authentic, most accurate visualization of a scientific principal.

00:06:45:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:45:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:45:100000.Dialogue: Oh, Sheldon, I'm sorry, but there aren't going to be any parades or judges or prizes.

00:06:52:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:52:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:52:070000.Dialogue: This party is just going to suck.

00:06:55:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:06:55:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:55:000000.Dialogue: No! Come on, it's going to be fun, and you all look great. I mean, look at you, Thor, and, oh, Peter Pan. That's so cute.

00:07:03:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:03:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:07:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:07:050000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:07:050000.Dialogue: And I got a handful of pixie dust with your name on it.

00:07:12:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:12:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:07:15:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:15:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:15:220000.Dialogue: Uh, hey, what's Sheldon supposed to be?

00:07:17:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:17:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:19:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:19:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:19:190000.Dialogue: Yes. It's the apparent change in the frequency of a wave caused by relative motion between the source of the wave and the observer.

00:07:28:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:28:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:28:100000.Dialogue: Oh, sure, I see it now. The Doppler effect. All right, I got to shower. You guys, um, make yourselves comfortable.

00:07:36:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:36:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:39:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:39:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:55:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:55:000000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:55:000000.Dialogue: By Odin's beard, this is good Chex mix.

00:07:58:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:07:58:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:58:190000.Dialogue: No, thanks. Peanuts. I can't afford to swell up in these tights.

00:08:03:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:03:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:03:120000.Dialogue: I'm confused. If there's no costume parade, what are we doing here?

00:08:08:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:08:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:11:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:11:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:14:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:14:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:08:14:100000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, when did you get here? Hi.

00:08:18:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:18:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:18:020000.Dialogue: Penny is wearing the worst Catwoman costume I've ever seen. And that includes Halle Berry's.

00:08:23:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:23:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:23:070000.Dialogue: She's not Catwoman. She's just a generic cat.

00:08:26:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:26:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:26:050000.Dialogue: And that's the kind of sloppy costuming which results from a lack of rules and competion.

00:08:33:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:33:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:33:190000.Dialogue: Hey, guys, check out the sexy nurse. I believe it's time for me to turn my head and cough.

00:08:42:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:42:100000.Speaker: Raj

00:08:43:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:43:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:43:140000.Dialogue: I'm going to use the mirror technique. She brushes her hair back, I brush my hair back... She shrugs, I shrug. Subconsciously she's thinking, We're in sync. We belong together.

00:08:52:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:52:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:52:140000.Dialogue: Where do you get this stuff?

00:08:55:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:08:55:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:55:000000.Dialogue: You know, psychology journals, Internet research, and there's this great show on VH-1 about how to pick up girls.

00:09:04:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:04:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:09:04:100000.Dialogue: Oh, if only I had his confidence. I have such difficulty speaking to women, or around women... or at times even effeminate men.

00:09:14:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:14:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:14:170000.Dialogue: If that's a working stethoscope, maybe you'd like to hear my heart skip a beat?

00:09:20:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:20:050000.Speaker: Nurse Costume Girl

00:09:21:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:21:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:21:120000.Dialogue: No, seriously, you can.I have transient idiopathic arrhythmia.

00:09:31:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:31:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:31:190000.Dialogue: I want to get to know Penny's friends, I just don't know how to talk to these people.

00:09:37:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:37:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:37:070000.Dialogue: Well, I actually might be able to help.

00:09:40:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:40:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:41:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:41:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:41:140000.Dialogue: Like Jane Goodall observing the apes, I initially saw their interactions as confusing and unstructured. But patterns emerge. They have their own language, if you will.

00:09:53:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:53:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:09:55:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:09:55:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:55:020000.Dialogue: Well, it seems that the newcomer approaches the existing group with the greeting, How wasted am I? Which is met with an approving chorus of Dude.

00:10:05:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:05:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:07:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:07:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:07:050000.Dialogue: That's as far as I've gotten.

00:10:10:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:10:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:10:050000.Dialogue: This is ridiculous. I'm jumping in.

00:10:13:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:13:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:13:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:13:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:15:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:15:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:17:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:17:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:19:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:19:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:19:070000.Dialogue: Aren't you afraid I'll embarrass you?

00:10:21:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:21:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:21:020000.Dialogue: Yes; but I need a wing man.

00:10:23:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:23:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:23:170000.Dialogue: All right, but if we're going to use flight metaphors, I'm much more suited to being the guy from the FAA analyzing wreckage.

00:10:34:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:34:020000.Speaker: Girl in Hippie Costume

00:10:35:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:35:000000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:36:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:36:140000.Speaker: Girl
00:10:36:140000.Dialogue: So what are you supposed to be?

00:10:38:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:38:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:38:140000.Dialogue: Me? I'll give you a hint.

00:10:45:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:45:020000.Speaker: Girl

00:10:46:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:46:220000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:50:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:50:220000.Speaker: Girl

00:10:55:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:10:55:070000.Speaker: Girl in Butterfly Costume

00:11:11:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:11:000000.Speaker: Girl

00:11:12:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:12:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:11:14:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:14:120000.Speaker: Girl
00:11:14:120000.Dialogue: Okay, if that's some sort of learning disability, I think it's very insensitive.

00:11:20:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:20:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:20:100000.Dialogue: Why don't you just tell people you're a zebra?

00:11:23:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:23:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:23:190000.Dialogue: Well, why don't you just tell people you're one of the seven dwarves?

00:11:27:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:27:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:28:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:28:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:28:070000.Dialogue: Yes, well, I'm the Doppler effect.

00:11:32:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:32:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:11:34:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:34:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:34:170000.Dialogue: What? What do you suppose he's doing here? Besides disrupting the local gravity field.

00:11:42:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:42:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:42:170000.Dialogue: If he were any bigger, he'd have moons orbiting him.

00:11:45:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:45:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:45:140000.Dialogue: Oh, snap. So, I guess we'll be leaving now.

00:11:50:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:50:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:50:220000.Dialogue: Why should we leave? For all we know he crashed the party and Penny doesn't even want him here.

00:11:58:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:11:58:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:12:00:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:00:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:00:170000.Dialogue: Maybe they want to be friends.

00:12:03:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:03:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:03:050000.Dialogue: Or maybe she wants to be friends and he wants something more.

00:12:07:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:07:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:07:020000.Dialogue: Then he and I are on equal ground.

00:12:09:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:09:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:09:070000.Dialogue: Yes, but you're much closer to it than he is.

00:12:13:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:13:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:13:170000.Dialogue: Look, if this was 1, 500 years ago, by virtue of his size and strength, Kurt would be entitled to his choice of female partners.

00:12:20:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:20:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:20:190000.Dialogue: And male partners, animal partners, large primordial eggplants-- pretty much whatever tickled his fancy.

00:12:27:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:27:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:27:050000.Dialogue: Yes, but our society has undergone a paradigm shift. In the Information Age, Sheldon, you and I are the alpha males. We shouldn't have to back down.

00:12:36:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:36:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:36:070000.Dialogue: True. Why don't you text him that and see if he backs down?

00:12:41:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:41:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:41:000000.Dialogue: No. I'm going to assert my dominance face-to-face.

00:12:46:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:46:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:46:220000.Dialogue: Face-to-face? Are you going to wait for him to sit down, or are you going to stand on the coffee table?

00:12:53:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:53:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:55:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:55:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:55:070000.Dialogue: Oh, hey, guys, are you having a good time?

00:12:57:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:12:57:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:57:100000.Dialogue: Given the reaction to my costume, this party is a scathing indictment of the American education system.

00:13:03:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:03:050000.Speaker: Kurt

00:13:06:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:06:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:09:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:09:050000.Speaker: Kurt
00:13:09:050000.Dialogue: And what are you supposed to be, an elf?

00:13:11:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:11:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:12:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:12:220000.Speaker: Kurt

00:13:14:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:14:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:14:120000.Dialogue: A hobbit is a mortal halfling inhabitant of Middle Earth, whereas an elf is an immortal, tall warrior.

00:13:21:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:21:000000.Speaker: Kurt
00:13:21:000000.Dialogue: So why the hell would you want to be a hobbit?

00:13:24:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:24:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:24:020000.Dialogue: Because he's neither tall nor immortal and none of us could be The Flash.

00:13:29:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:29:070000.Speaker: Kurt
00:13:29:070000.Dialogue: Well, whatever. Why don't you go hop off on a quest? I'm talking to Penny here.

00:13:33:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:33:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:33:190000.Dialogue: I think we're all talking to Penny here.

00:13:35:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:35:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:38:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:38:070000.Speaker: Kurt
00:13:38:070000.Dialogue: Okay, maybe you didn't hear me. Go away.

00:13:40:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:40:000000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:42:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:42:050000.Speaker: Kurt
00:13:42:050000.Dialogue: Oh, I am being nice. Right, little buddy?

00:13:46:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:46:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:46:170000.Dialogue: Okay. I understand your impulse to try to physically intimidate me. I mean, you can't compete with me on an intellectual level so you're driven to animalistic puffery.

00:13:58:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:13:58:170000.Speaker: Kurt
00:13:58:170000.Dialogue: You calling me a puffy animal?

00:14:01:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:01:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:01:050000.Dialogue: Of course not. No, he's not. You're not, right, Leonard?

00:14:05:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:05:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:05:120000.Dialogue: No, I said animalistic. Of course we're all animals, but some of us have climbed a little higher on the evolutionary tree.

00:14:13:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:13:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:13:070000.Dialogue: If he understands that, you're in trouble.

00:14:15:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:15:140000.Speaker: Kurt

00:14:17:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:17:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:19:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:19:220000.Speaker: Kurt
00:14:19:220000.Dialogue: You know, you use a lot of big words for such a little dwarf.

00:14:23:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:23:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:24:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:24:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:24:220000.Dialogue: Penny, it's okay. I can handle this.

00:14:28:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:28:000000.Speaker: Penny

00:14:29:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:29:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:29:170000.Dialogue: I'm a hobbit. A hobbit. Are misfiring neurons in your hippocampus preventing the conversion from short-term to long-term memory?

00:14:40:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:40:120000.Speaker: Kurt
00:14:40:120000.Dialogue: Okay, now you're starting to make me mad.

00:14:43:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:43:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:43:170000.Dialogue: A homo habilis discovering his opposable thumbs says what?

00:14:48:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:48:120000.Speaker: Kurt

00:14:54:100000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:54:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:54:100000.Dialogue: I think I've made my point.

00:14:55:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:55:220000.Speaker: Kurt
00:14:55:220000.Dialogue: Yeah? How about I make a point out of your pointy little head?

00:14:59:070000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:14:59:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:59:070000.Dialogue: Let me remind you, while my moral support is absolute, in a physical confrontation, I will be less than useless.

00:15:05:050000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:05:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:05:050000.Dialogue: There's not going to be a confrontation. In fact, I doubt if he can even spell confrontation.

00:15:13:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:13:020000.Speaker: Kurt

00:15:18:170000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:18:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:18:170000.Dialogue: Kurt, put him down this instant!

00:15:20:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:20:140000.Speaker: Kurt

00:15:21:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:21:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:21:140000.Dialogue: I don't care. I'm finishing it.Put him down!

00:15:24:190000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:24:190000.Speaker: Kurt
00:15:24:190000.Dialogue: Fine. You're one lucky little leprechaun.

00:15:31:220000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:31:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:31:220000.Dialogue: He's a hobbit! I got your back.

00:15:36:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:36:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:15:37:140000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:37:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:37:140000.Dialogue: Yeah, I'm fine. It's good, it's a good party, thanks for having us. It's just getting a little late, so...

00:15:46:120000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:46:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:46:120000.Dialogue: Oh, okay. All right, well, thank you for coming.

00:15:53:000000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:53:000000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:58:020000.Scene: The hallway. Howard knocks on Penny’s door with his bow.
00:15:58:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:58:020000.Dialogue: If it's any consolation, I thought that homo habilis line really put him in his place.

00:16:11:220000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:11:220000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:13:050000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:13:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:13:050000.Dialogue: Tea. When people are upset, the cultural convention is to bring them hot beverages.

00:16:26:050000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:26:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:30:190000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:30:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:30:190000.Dialogue: You want to talk about it?

00:16:32:050000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:32:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:35:000000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:35:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:35:000000.Dialogue: There, there was really all I had.

00:16:38:170000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:38:170000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:39:190000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:39:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:48:000000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:48:000000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:49:050000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:49:050000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:50:120000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:50:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:50:120000.Dialogue: Hey, I just wanted to make sure you were okay.

00:16:52:120000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:52:120000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:55:190000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:55:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:55:190000.Dialogue: I am so sorry about what happened.

00:16:58:100000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:16:58:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:00:050000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:17:00:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:00:050000.Dialogue: Yes, it is. That's why I broke up with him. He always does stuff like that.

00:17:06:000000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:17:06:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:06:000000.Dialogue: So why was he at your party?

00:17:09:220000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:17:09:220000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:09:220000.Dialogue: Well, I ran into him last week and he was just all apologetic about how he's changed. And he was just going on and on and... I believed him and I'm an idiot because I always believe guys like that. And I can't go back to my party because he's there. And know you don't want to hear this and I'm upset and I'm really drunk and I just want to...

00:17:40:000000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:17:40:000000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:45:070000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:17:45:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:45:070000.Dialogue: God, what is wrong with me?

00:17:47:020000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:17:47:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:49:020000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:17:49:020000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:50:070000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:17:50:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:54:120000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:17:54:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:54:120000.Dialogue: You really think so, don't you?

00:18:10:140000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:10:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:11:220000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:11:220000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:14:000000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:14:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:14:000000.Dialogue: How much have you had to drink tonight?

00:18:18:170000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:18:170000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:22:190000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:22:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:22:190000.Dialogue: Are you sure that your being drunk and your being angry with Kurt doesn't have something to do with what's going on here?

00:18:31:020000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:31:020000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:31:020000.Dialogue: It might. Boy, you're really smart.

00:18:37:100000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:37:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:44:170000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:44:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:44:170000.Dialogue: Leonard, you are so great. Why can't all guys be like you?

00:18:49:170000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:49:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:49:170000.Dialogue: Because if all guys were like me, the human race couldn't survive.

00:18:58:000000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:58:000000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:59:190000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:18:59:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:19:10:050000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:19:10:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:19:22:000000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:19:22:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:22:000000.Dialogue: That's right, you saw what you saw.

00:19:26:140000.Scene: The living room. Sheldon brings Leonard a cup of tea.
00:19:26:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:26:140000.Dialogue: That's how we roll in the Shire.

00:19:37:140000.Scene: The apartment, there is a knock on the door.
00:19:37:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:44:000000.Scene: The apartment, there is a knock on the door.
00:19:44:000000.Speaker: Howard

00:19:46:170000.Scene: The apartment, there is a knock on the door.
00:19:46:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:46:170000.Dialogue: He's not here. Maybe the Avengers summoned him.

00:19:52:020000.Scene: The apartment, there is a knock on the door.
00:19:52:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:52:020000.Dialogue: He's not the Marvel Comics Thor, he's the original Norse god.

00:19:55:070000.Scene: The apartment, there is a knock on the door.
00:19:55:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:19:57:190000.Scene: The apartment, there is a knock on the door.
00:19:57:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:19:57:190000.Dialogue: I'm supposed to give him a ride home.

00:19:59:020000.Scene: The apartment, there is a knock on the door.
00:19:59:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:59:020000.Dialogue: Well, I'm sure he'll be fine. He has his hammer.

00:20:10:020000.Scene: A random bedroom. Butterfly costume girl is climbing off of Raj.
00:20:10:020000.Speaker: Butterfly Girl
00:20:10:020000.Dialogue: I have to say, you are an amazing man. You're gentle, and passionate. And, my God, you are such a good listener.
